name: Tidal Forces
explanation: Tidal forces arise from gravitational gradient - difference in gravitational pull across an object. Tidal force ∝ 1/d³ (stronger than gravitational force's 1/d²). Causes ocean tides, tidal locking, and can tear apart objects (Roche limit). Explains why Moon always shows same face to Earth and why some moons are geologically active.

examples.problem: Why are tides stronger when Moon is closer?
examples.solution: Tidal force ∝ 1/d³, so small distance change causes large force change
steps: Tidal force decreases faster with distance

examples.problem: What causes two high tides per day?
examples.solution: Tidal bulge on both near and far sides of Earth
steps: Near side: Moon pulls water toward it
Far side: Moon pulls Earth away from water
Earth rotates, so two high tides per rotation
